poem:
Title: "Visions in a Fiscal Dawn"

Ravens peck at digits, picked them clean,
From the hand that feeds, painted a lurid green.
As twilight breathes life into economic machines,
Eighth-bred millions mock the less serene.
Bulgaria's daughter weaves threads golden,
Two years strong, her saga unfolds.
Gallic approval in her satchel,
Economies in line, like dominoes on the mantel.
